value.name: UPDATE 1-GM Cruise robotaxi unit faces US probes over dragging incident, vows reforms
value.description: GM's Cruise self-driving car unit on Thursday revealed U.S. Justice Department and Securities and Exchange Commission probes stemming from an October accident in which one of its robotaxis dragged a pedestrian who had been struck by another car.

value.name: French top court nixes cushy visa deal for rich Brits
value.description: "The Constitutional Court has green-lit the government's original bill," Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin, who spearheaded the legislation, tweeted on X. "Never has a law provided so many means for expelling delinquents and so many obligations to integrate newcomers."

value.description: Reform UK is more popular than at any point in its history, according to opinion polling, which shows 13 per cent of Britons would vote for the party if the general election was held now.

value.description: On Thursday, Immediate Past-President Dean Wilson and Government Relations Manager Marisa Myers of the Ohio State Bar Association (Ohio Bar) presented at the inaugural meeting of a General Assembly task force proposed reforms for the state’s indigent defense system.

value.name: Farage is sending the Tories into an existential panic
value.description: Another split is over what to do about Reform itself. Some Tories think they could fashion a pact with the party, though Tice has been clear he wants to stand candidates against all of them, and Farage has described Sunak as a “lame duck”.

value.name: Royal Mail delivery days could be cut to three a week
value.description: Ofcom has proposed reducing Royal Mail delivery days to five or even three days a week among new cost-cutting plans

value.name: Digital Weekly: Network reform; Nature based solutions; UW Forum
value.description: The need to improve co-ordination between electricity distribution and transmission is the subject of analysis in our latest digital weekly edition. We also examine the challenges in rolling out blue-green infrastructure and pick out some highlights from Utility Week Forum,

value.name: Council leaders call for reform of local government finance following ‘drop in the ocean’ emergency fund for social care
value.description: COUNCIL leaders have called for reform of local government finance and an end to “short-term” measures after Michael Gove confirmed that authorities will receive £500 million in emergency funding for social care.

value.name: State Pension proposal to link amount to minimum wage would see huge weekly rise
value.description: A proposed reform to the State Pension would see the amount linked to the minimum wage and paid from an earlier age, bringing a huge increase to millions. Campaigners want to see the State Pension lifted to £549.12 per week from April 2024, far higher than the £221.20 the full new State Pension will reach at that time.

value.description: It’s hypocrisy for the PM to claim peers are frustrating ‘the will of the people’ after years of refusing to reform the upper chamber, says Guardian columnist Martin Kettle

value.name: Rishi Sunak insists he is making 'progress' as Tory rebels plot to replace him with the party just SEVEN points ahead of Nigel Farage's Reform while Labour has a lead of 34 in ...
value.description: Two polls released today gave Labour a huge lead in its main target seats, and gave the Conservatives a narrowing lead over third-placed Reform UK.

value.name: Milei's Argentina 'omnibus' bill faces gauntlet after clearing first hurdle
value.description: BUENOS AIRES (Reuters) - Argentine President Javier Milei's "omnibus" bill, a sprawling reform package ranging from tax hikes to privatizations, has cleared its first hurdle in Congress with a green light from a lower house committee. It now faces far tougher obstacles.

value.name: Mark Drakeford admits Welsh independence is 'viable'
value.description: WALES’ First Minister Mark Drakeford has admitted Welsh independence is “viable” providing the people of the country back the move.

value.name: Nortreus raises concern about Haiti's next leaders; calls for possible Accord renewal
value.description: Haitian politician Werley Nortreus raised concern about Haiti 39;s next leaders and possible long-term development on Sunday.

value.name: Questions raised over sale of Billingham town centre to London investment group
value.description: Questions have been raised about the sale of Billingham town centre to an investment group and the council's regeneration plans.

value.name: Politics latest news: Tories ‘serve no purpose’, says Farage after Reform records highest ever support
value.description: Nigel Farage claimed the Red Wall will desert the Tories at the next general election with Rishi Sunak as leader. Mr Farage said that with Mr Sunak leading the Conservative Party “the Red Wall is completely and utterly gone”.

value.name: Reform UK won't field candidate for York and North Yorkshire mayor
value.description: Reform UK has confirmed that it will not field a candidate in May’s York and North Yorkshire’s mayoral election.

value.name: Sadiq Khan is told to 'go back down the back of the sofa' as he demands MORE taxpayer money for '£140m' reform of the Met Police
value.description: Sadiq Khan has urged UK government ministers to hand over more cash to help with the reform of the Metropolitan Police .

value.name: Labour holds huge 34-point lead in key marginal seats, YouGov poll finds
value.description: Labour holds a mammoth lead over the Tories in the key marginals it needs to win a majority at the general election, a new YouGov poll has found. Sir Keir Starmer ’s party is an incredible 34 points ahead of Rishi Sunak ’s party in 150 crucial target constituencies.
